title: Website: Separate community page
description:
The important community info like mailing list, source code, issue tracker mm is now hidden within the looong http://lucene.apache.org/solr/resources.html page.

This effort will move the content from resources.html#community to a new community.html page. See draft version at http://lucene.apache.org/solr/community.html

comments.author: Jan Høydahl
comments.content:
The change will also add a new Support section to the community page pointing to https://wiki.apache.org/solr/Support and setting expectations for how the community normally supports the product along with a table showing the relevant versions/branches.

When publishing the site, I'll also add COMMUNITY to the top menu, and a few community links to the footer.

comments.author: Jan Høydahl
comments.content:
Check the footer of http://lucene.staging.apache.org/solr/community.html (staging) for a proposal to add a set of COMMUNITY links here.

I'm thinking about moving the Powered By section back from community.html to resources.html, it is kind of a resource to study other implementations, what do you think? It will also keep the community page less crowded.

comments.author: Jan Høydahl
comments.content: This is now put live, without moving PoweredBy back to Resources. Resolving for now, but please yell out if you see any glitches!
